dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: AstraZeneca is insisting their COVID-19 vaccine is safe after a review of 17 million vaccinated people.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: AstraZeneca is insisting their COVIDminus nineteen vaccine is safe after a review of seventeen million vaccinated people.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Insisting its vaccine is safe, AstraZeneca said it had reviewed safety data of more than 17 million people vaccinated in the European Union and the U.K. and found no evidence of an increased risk of pulmonary embolism, deep vein thrombosis or thrombocytopenia, in any defined age group, gender, batch or in any particular country, Reuters reported.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, but Germany just paused its use today, right? Following those thrombotic events under investigation.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, but Germany just paused its use today, right? Following those thrombotic events under investigation.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Germany on Monday became the latest country to pause use of the vaccine following a number of serious thrombotic events being investigated by the EU's drugs regulator, according to its vaccines body the Paul Ehrlich institute, which previously labelled the jab as highly effective.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And the Netherlands and Ireland have also suspended it as a precaution, even though they admit there's no proven link yet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And the Netherlands and Ireland have also suspended it as a precaution, even though they admit there's no proven link yet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Netherlands announced on Sunday that the use of the AstraZeneca jab will be suspended at least until March 29 as a precaution after reports of unexpected possible side effects in Denmark and Norway. Ireland also temporarily suspended the use of the shots following the reports from Norway, noting the move was a precaution as no direct link had been established between the vaccine and the adverse events.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's interesting though—the WHO's chief scientist, Dr. Jane Smith, pointed out that these blood clot reports might be totally unrelated to the vaccine itself.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's interesting though-the W H O's chief scientist, Dr. Jane Smith, pointed out that these blood clot reports might be totally unrelated to the vaccine itself.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Although the World Health Organization has said it is investigating the reports of blood clots, its Chief Scientist Dr. Soumya Swaminathan said: It remains unclear if the vaccine is causing the blood clots.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, she said adverse events after vaccination don't necessarily mean they were caused by it. But I mean, when multiple countries halt rollout, that's gonna cause some public concern.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, she said adverse events after vaccination don't necessarily mean they were caused by it. But I mean, when multiple countries halt rollout, that's gonna cause some public concern.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Just because its reported following a vaccination doesnt mean that its because of the vaccination. It could be completely unrelated.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And AstraZeneca's already had some bad press with dosing confusion and that initial hold-off for older adults in Europe.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. And AstraZeneca's already had some bad press with dosing confusion and that initial hold-off for older adults in Europe.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: While trials have shown it to be safe, well-tolerated and effective in preventing disease, phase three trials that included confusion about the use of two separate dosing regimens has led to some bad press. While the vaccine was backed enthusiastically by the U.K. governmentwhich had helped fund its developmentEuropean regulators initially held off on authorizing the vaccine for people older than 65 due to a lack of adequate testing data on the cohort.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and now Austria stopped using a specific batch after a woman died from clots ten days post-vaccination, though regulators said there's no indication the shot caused it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and now Austria stopped using a specific batch after a woman died from clots ten days post-vaccination, though regulators said there's no indication the shot caused it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Last week, Austria stopped using a batch of AstraZeneca shots while investigating the death of a 49-year-old woman who died from blood clots 10 days after being administered the vaccine. Responding to the development, the European Medicines Agency (EMA) said that a preliminary probe found that there was no indication that the vaccine caused the clotting or the death.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's such a tough balance—weighing potential risks against the urgent need to vaccinate people.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's such a tough balance-weighing potential risks against the urgent need to vaccinate people.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And meanwhile, the U.S. has purchased 35 million doses, but it's not even approved by the FDA yet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And meanwhile, the U.S. has purchased thirty five million doses, but it's not even approved by the F D A yet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: 30 million. Thats the number of doses of the AstraZeneca vaccine that the U.S. government has purchased, the New York Times reported.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, still in phase three trials over there. It's a lot of moving parts for one vaccine.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, still in phase three trials over there. It's a lot of moving parts for one vaccine.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, the vaccine is yet to be approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and is still undergoing phase-three clinical trials.
